resources.string: Have questions or want to suggest new app features? Please contact faqr.app@gmail.com

FAQr is not affiliated with GameFAQs.com in any way.\n\nFAQr has been tested on a large number of FAQs, but it hasn\'t been tested on every FAQ. Feel free to use the contact info in Google Play store to report about FAQs that are having problems before simply leaving a poor review.

Search the FAQ for the query string. When you are typing you will see that term highlighted in the FAQ. Use the Previous and Next buttons to cycle through all occurrences of the term throughout the FAQ.

FAQr is the ultimate FAQs reader application for Android. You just search for a FAQ by game title, and the FAQ will be downloaded and available for you offline whenever you need it in an easy to use FAQr reader format.
It used to be that reading FAQs on a mobile or tablet device could be a pain.
Finally we have the right tool for the job!
\u2605 FAQr always keeps track of your current position in the FAQ so that when you come back to the FAQ you are ready to pick up right back where you left off.
\u2605 You can bookmark locations in the FAQ just by long pressing on that section, then you may quickly return it with the My FAQmarks option.

\u2605 FAQr automatically configures your reader\'s font sizes and screen configuration, and then every FAQ will automatically load with those settings so that you never need to fool with resizing text again!
\u2605 FAQr gives you fast scrolling to quickly access any part of the FAQ in an instant with high precision, and gives you the ability to customize the theme so you can read it how you want to.
\u2605 FAQr saves the FAQ for convienent offline reading no matter where you are.
You can lock the current orientation of the screen by tapping Lock. Later you can unlock the orientation by tapping Unlock in the menu.

★ Featuring the Final Fantasy IV FAQ by Johnathan 'Zy' Sawyer
★ Using ActionBarSherlock developed by Jake Wharton
★ Using StickyListHeaders developed by Emil Sjölander
★ Uses Jsoup HTML Parser by Jonathan Hedley
You can reload the FAQ from the web using this menu option if you need to. WARNING This will also erase all your current and saved position information.

You can save any location in the FAQ by simply tapping the section that you wish to save. You will see a confimation that the section is saved. Later you can use the Go to Saved location to take you back to the saved position. You can toggle whether you want the saved section to have a different color in Settings.
Search the web for new GameFAQs by game title. Navigate the FAQ selection screens, and then the FAQ will be automatically downloaded for offline reading.

You can toggle various options in the Settings menu. Here you can change you theme (Dark or Light), hide the Android notification and action bar, keep the screen on, choose to use a variable font, set the font size for monospace and variable space fonts separately, choose to use a serif or sans font for the variable spaced font, and choose whether to highlight the saved position with a different color.
Open last FAQ when starting the app
The URL of the currently saved FAQ
Hide the action bar on scroll
Hide the notification bar only in landscape
Highlight the saved position with a different color
The font size for the mono spaced font
Show dialog before exiting the app
Highlight the saved position with a different background
The number of lines to show in the preview on My FAQmarks
Use dark background with light text
Dim the notification bar while reading
Use a serif font for the variable spaced font
Use a variable spaced font only on text based sections
The font size for the variable spaced font
